avalancheActivity.comment: A hiker triggered a small avalanche in Esjan on the 8th of Jan in a W-facing slope at around 400 m a.s.l. A small avalanche released in Reykjafell in Mosfellsbær on Jan 6th. Avalanches released on the evening of Jan 5th, over Grafningsvegur by Þingvallavatn, in Svínahlíð.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow has subsided and melted due to thawing and rain. The snowpack is expected to be rather stable after the thaw and rain.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Snow has subsided and melted due to thawing and rain. The snowpack is expected to be rather stable after the thaw and rain the last days. Prior to the thaw, snowfall in variable directions formed small wind slabs in isolated spots in the mountains and gullies, while most areas had hard-packed, old, stable snow. A few small slabs released, and weak layers observed in snow pits indicated instability.

travelAdvisory.comment: Snow has subsided and melted due to thawing and rain. Continued thaw with consid. rain in the western part. Small wet avalanches or even slush flows may be expected.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Snow has subsided and melted due to thawing and rain. Continued thaw with consid. rain in the western part. Small wet avalanches or even slush flows may be expected.

weatherForecast.highlights: Sunnan 10-18m/s á miðvikudag, rigning eða skúrir. Dregur úr vindi á fimmtudag, breytileg eða norðlæg átt og kólnar með lítilsháttar úrkomu, mögulega snjókoma til fjalla.

avalancheActivity.highlights: The snowpack has subsided and strengthened during thaw and rain. Avalanche danger is considered low.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Layered, relatively thin wind slabs and persistent weak layers were present in the mountains before the thaw that began on Friday, January 10th. Since then, snow has settled in warm weather and rain, becoming more uniform and stronger. Snow sensors indicate that the snow has reached an isothermal state in many areas. When temperatures drop below freezing point, the snow should stiffen and strengthen further.

travelAdvisory.comment: Snow has subsided and melted due to thawing and rain. Continued thaw with consid. rain in the western part. Small wet avalanches or even slush flows may be expected.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Snow has subsided and melted due to thawing and rain. Continued thaw with consid. rain in the western part. Small wet avalanches or even slush flows may be expected.

weatherForecast.highlights: Rigning og allhvöss sunnan- og suðvestanátt á miðvikudag. Frystir á fimmtudag og úrkomulítið eftir það.

avalancheActivity.comment: A snowmobile triggered an avalanche in Upsadalur west of Dalvik on Thursday January 9th. A natural avalanche fell in Dýjadalur, either on January 9th or 10th and a small slab in Klarsárdalur.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The snowpack has subsided and strengthened due to thaw. Unstable wind slabs are still possible at high elevation.

snowpackStructure.highlights: The snowpack has settled in the mild weather. At high elevations, where the thaw has less impact, unstable wind slabs may still exist, especially in gullies and areas sheltered from SW and S winds. Mild weather is forecast until Thursday, so the snow is expected to continue to settle, strengthen, and subside. When temperatures drop below freezing point, the snow should stiffen and strengthen further.

travelAdvisory.comment: Snow has subsided and melted due to thawing and rain. Continued thaw with consid. rain in the western part. Small wet avalanches or even slush flows may be expected.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Snow has subsided and melted due to thawing and rain. Continued thaw with consid. rain in the western part. Small wet avalanches or even slush flows may be expected.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hvassar suðlægar áttir, frostlaust upp í fjallatoppa og dálítil rigning. Kólnar seinnipart fimmtudags og úrkomulítið eftir það.

avalancheActivity.comment: Small wet avalanche released in Fannardalur the 12th of January.Two avalanches released in Bjólfur on january 7th and one small avalanche above Neskaupstaður.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow has subsided and melted due to thawing and rain. The snowpack is considered stable after the thaw.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Snow has subsided and melted due to thawing and rain. TThe snowpack is considered stable after the thaw. There is some is in gullies and cliffs, and there has been some ice collapse during the thaw.

travelAdvisory.comment: Snow has subsided and melted due to thawing and rain. Continued thaw with consid. rain in the western part. Small wet avalanches or even slush flows may be expected.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Snow has subsided and melted due to thawing and rain. Continued thaw with consid. rain in the western part. Small wet avalanches or even slush flows may be expected.

weatherForecast.highlights: Suðvestan 10-18m/s á miðvikudag og yfirleitt þurrt. Suðlæg átt og lítlsháttar rigning með köflum, kólnar með kvöldi á fimmtudag.
